author: nanook
title: NFL teams' charitable efforts as part of protests: a running list
summary: Here's what NFL teams are doing in the wake of protests to help their communities.

author: nanook
title: Rush Limbaugh Suggests Trump Is Acting like a Dictator and Is Making Him 'Nervous'
summary: Donald Trump’s comments about the NFL are starting to make Rush Limbaugh feel nervous, the conservative radio host said on his show Wednesday. Limbaugh, who has previously expressed his concern about Trump’s tweets, made his feelings on the president’s interference in the ongoing NFL protests clear on his show. "There’s a part of this story that’s starting to make me nervous, and it’s this: I am very uncomfortable with the president of the United States being able to dictate the behavior and power of anybody.

author: nanook
title: Division III player kicked off team after kneeling for national anthem
summary: A spokesperson for Albright College said the player decided to kneel after the team made a group decision to kneel before the anthem and stand during it.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Lawsuit: Adrian Peterson defaulted on $2.4 million loan
summary: MINNEAPOLIS (AP) -- A lawsuit filed in Minneapolis accuses former Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson of defaulting on a $2.4 million loan.

author: third_watch
title: Gerald McCoy says it will be an 'uproar' if NFL players are forced to stand during anthem
summary: Gerald McCoy said that forcing a player to stand is "taking away a constitutional right to freedom of speech."

author: captainunderoos
title: Cowboys release Nolan Carroll
summary: The Cowboys signed cornerback Nolan Carroll to a three-year contract with $4 million in guaranteed money this offseason, but he’s gone from Dallas before playing in three games. Mike Garafolo of NFL Media was the first to report that the Cowboys have decided to part ways with Carroll. Carroll started the first two games of [ more]

author: third_watch
title: Week 6 Fantasy Sleepers: Heavenly results on tap for Kamara
summary: With Adrian Peterson vacationing in the desert, Alvin Kamara could be the Saints' new RB king.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Goodell looks for resolution in anthem controversy; owners to decide on rules next week
summary: Now league owners will meet to rule – maybe once and for all – what freedoms can or can’t be expressed during the playing of the national anthem on game day.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Ex-Michigan standout Jourdan Lewis fires back at Skip Bayless
summary: It got real for Fox Sports 1 analyst Skip Bayless on Tuesday. Former Michigan standout Jourdan Lewis defended himself on social media after being criticized by Bayless.    Aaron Rodgers led the Packers on a game-winning drive, which ended with a 12-yard touchdown pass catch by Davante Adams with 11 seconds left in a 34-31 win at AT&T Stadium on Sunday. “I felt it coming, but got my head around a little too late,” Lewis told told the Ft. Worth Star-Telegram. "Of Rodgers' back-shoulder fade to Adams. “(Rodgers) threw it exactly where it had to be. Great placement on the ball. (Adams) made a great play on the ball.” Lewis responded earlier today on Twitter.  Lewis, drafted by the Cowboys in the
